document_title: Systemic lupus erythematosus: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Because this is an autoimmune disease and the cause of the disease is unknown, it is difficult to prevent the development of lupus erythematosus. However, some high-risk subjects can prevent the disease by paying attention to warning signs of the disease such as symptoms of fatigue, characteristic skin rashes, abdominal pain, joint pain, and dizziness. face. Early detection of symptoms helps patients receive early diagnosis and treatment, helping to reduce the negative impact of the disease on health, reducing treatment costs and time spent in the hospital. (5)
Besides, high-risk groups can proactively prevent by:
Limit sun exposure, use sunscreen, long-sleeved clothes, scarves and hats when going out.; Have a scientific and healthy lifestyle; Get vaccinated to boost your immune system.; Limit intake of foods made from animal fats, abstain from stimulants such as alcohol, beer, cigarettes, etc.
